comment._content: Big Tim Sullivan and his wife Helen Fitzgerald Sullivan adopted Aida (or Ada) as a 2-year-old foundling, but there were strong suspicions that she was Tim's biological daughter (he had several children by various women). After Helen died, and Tim was declared mentally incompetent, Aida lived with her Fitzgerald grandparents. Aida was not named in Tim's will in 1913, so she sued, and eventually won a sizeable settlement from the estate. Tim Sullivan's wikipedia entry: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timothy_Sullivan She became a performer with Ziegfeld Follies, and was briefly married to a William Epstein.
